intro: Tibetiodes flaccida, commonly known as the Tibetan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are often hairy and narrow, which helps reduce water loss. Tibetiodes flaccida is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
